poem:
**Mosaic of Brothers**

Olive groves—  
coal dust in the throat.  

Two boys:  
same bones, same blood  
but one keeps turning  
toward the sea.  

A father  
with pockets full of small crimes  
calls it hope.  

Spain, 2003—  
sun on the knife edge.  

Northumberland—  
black rain.  

The dead don't bleed;  
the living do, quietly.

Until now, Rollinson has been known as a poet; his collection Talking Dead was shortlisted for the 2015 Costa poetry prize.
